forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 57. Southwest wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain between 8pm and 1am, then rain likely and patchy fog. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. Southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The dawn of this November day in Boston reveals a landscape painted with soft blue hues and a gentle tranquility that beckons the soul to take a moment. With the sun climbing steadily, the city seems to bask under a canopy of partly sunny skies, where the chill in the air whispers tales of the impending winter yet to come. A brisk southwest wind dances through the streets, stirring fallen leaves and carrying a hint of that autumnal crispness. As the hours unfold and evening approaches, the atmosphere will shift—clouds will gather, and whispers of rain will turn into a steady rhythm, inviting moments of reflection and warmth indoors.

For those who venture out today, a layered approach to dressing will be wise. A lightweight sweater beneath a comfortable jacket will keep you snug as you navigate the cool gusts. Perhaps a stroll along the Charles River, with its glistening reflections, can offer a serene escape, or visiting a cozy café for a warm drink could be a delightful interlude to your day. However, should you need to be on the road after sunset, anticipate a low visibility cloaked in patchy fog, where the rain will insist on its presence through the night. Embrace the subtle shifting of the weather, letting it guide your choices of attire and activity, finding comfort in the beauty of this ever-changing autumn day.
